data.title: James Leister Obituary
data.meta_description: Aug. 28, 1925 - Sept. 22, 2013    Colonel James William Leister, Sr. (ret.) passed away Sunday, September 22, 2013 in Alma, MI with loving family by his sid
data.text:
James William Leister OBITUARY

Aug. 28, 1925 â€“ Sept. 22, 2013 Colonel James William Leister, Sr. (ret.) passed away Sunday, September 22, 2013 in Alma, MI with loving family by his side. He was born August 28, 1925 in Owensville, IN. He graduated from Princeton High School, attended Indiana University, and graduated from the University of Illinois.

His career in the United States Army began prior to his college graduation and culminated in achieving the rank of colonel. During this time he served in both the Korean War, where he was awarded the Silver Star, and two tours during the Vietnam Conflict. Upon retirement from the Army he served as campaign manager for the Honorable Congressman Ron Marlenee of Montana. He was also the managing coordinator for the Sparklers Organization promoting tourism in Corpus Christi, TX.

He was preceded in death by his parents, John P. and Carmen (Brown) Leister.

He is survived by his loving wife of 65 years, Patricia (Johnston) Leister. He is also survived by two sons, James (Kimberly Smith) Leister, Jr. and John (Michelle Olds) Leister, Athletic Director at Alma College; six grandchildren, Jamie (Matt) Smith, Stayce (Alison McCurley) Leister, Nicole, Jarrett, Hailey, and Alyssa; and two great-grandchildren, Robyn and Olivia; also surviving is their most faithful canine companion, Andy.
